bibl.title: A Bronze Representing Tapsais of Kellis. Avec résumés en français et en anglais.
bibl.note: Bronze votive statuette found in 1992 in the Main Temple at Ismant el-Kharab (Kellis) in the Dakhleh Oasis (now in the New Valley Museum in Kharga, Inv. 1583), second or third century AD. It represents the goddess Tapsais. A dedicatory inscription in Greek has been incised into the legs of the goddess.
bibl.seg: KAPER Olaf E. and Klaas A. WORP, A Bronze Representing Tapsais of Kellis. Avec résumés en français et en anglais.
REg 46 (1995) pp. 107-118, 5 figg. et pll. IX-XI.

Bronze votive statuette found in 1992 in the Main Temple at Ismant el-Kharab (Kellis) in the Dakhleh Oasis (now in the New Valley Museum in Kharga, Inv. 1583), second or third century AD. It represents the goddess Tapsais. A dedicatory inscription in Greek has been incised into the legs of the goddess.
